intro: Phacelia gooddingii, commonly known as Goodding's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe habitats. It plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
